faq.title: Common problems when playing Dota 2 6.84
faq.description: Problems with launching, configuring and connecting to game servers

version.title: What version of the game are you using?

content.part1: We are playing on version 6.84c. This is the latest version of the game on
content.part2: , and also the most popular patch by number of players.

content.part1: The client was downloaded directly from official Steam depots, meaning it is completely authentic. The servers run on the official Valve tool — srcds.exe, as expected. Therefore, bans are excluded.
content.part2: The site uses a secure Steam service via the OpenID protocol to authorize you - it does not transmit your login, password, or other personal data. This method has long been used on many third-party resources.

ban.title: Can I play with a ban in dota?

content.part1: Bans from the current version of Dota do not apply to us - they are not transferred to this client. But if you regularly leave games, ruin the match for others, or behave openly toxic, you can get a ban here. We monitor the order and do not turn a blind eye.

console.title: How to open console?
console.content: Bind in control settings and launch the game via batch file (the parameter -console is specified there)

settings.title: My game settings are messed up / quickcasts don't work

content.part1: Disable Steam Cloud (for modern Dota and globally on Steam) and do not agree to synchronization. On the way
content.part3: in config.cfg in the file properties, uncheck the read-only box, if it exists.

connection.title: I can't connect to the game server

content.checkAccounts: Check if the accounts on the site and on Steam match.
content.ukraineNote: If you are from Ukraine or the previous methods did not help, try using tools to bypass Internet provider blocking.
content.internetNote: If you are already using it, try disabling it
content.redownload: Redownload and re-unzip the client using 7-zip.

newDota.title: I have a new Dota opening, not the old one

content.part1: Before connecting to the server, first open the old client. Enter the data from the table about the accepted game (in the connect ip format) into the console and press Enter.

clientLimit.title: Only one dota 2 client per customer

content.part1: Close the new or old Dota client if it is already open (kill the process via task manager). Only 1 Dota client can be running at a time.
You need to write cd in the .bat file using notepad at the beginning
content.path: C:\Program Files (x86)\Dota 6.84 (replace with the path to the client with the old Dota)

launchError.title: The game won't start, what should I do?

content.part1: You are most likely missing something. Possible solutions:

possibleSolutions.part1: You have not unpacked the archive with the game and are trying to run the game from the archive. Unpack the archive using 7-zip and run the game.
possibleSolutions.part2: Try clearing your Steam download cache or switching accounts before launching the old client.
possibleSolutions.part4: Install Microsoft Visual C++ for 32 bit
possibleSolutions.part5: Install Microsoft Visual C++ for 64 bit
possibleSolutions.part7: If nothing helps, reinstall the operating system.

steamClient.title: Steam client is missing or out of date

content.part1: One of the following options will help you fix this problem:
content.solution4: Turn off stealth mode in Steam
content.solution5: Run DOTA Classic and Steam as administrator

launcherError.title: Failed to load the launcher DLL / Setup file 'gameinfo.txt' doesn't exist in subdirectory 'dota2'

content.part1: The archive with the game may not have been fully unpacked. We strongly recommend using 7-zip to unpack.
content.part2: To fix it, you need to exclude Russian/Cyrillic letters in the path or unpack the archive to your desktop. If this does not help, then unpack the archive with the game to the root of the C: or D: drive.

content.driverInstall: Reinstall video drivers, or install a later / newer version
content.audioRestart: Run snd_restart command in Windows command line or reinstall audio driver
content.disableExtras: Disable all additional graphics options in the game settings
content.switchToDiscrete: Switch from integrated to discrete video card
content.ifNotHelped: IF THE PAST DIDN'T HELP: write one by one (checking the result after each command):
content.startupParams: Using startup parameters in the bat file, set: -dxlevel 80, 81, 90, 95, 98 or -gl

keybindAbility.title: Is there a way to enable ability stop with a separate key (like rearm on tinker)?
keybindAbility.content: No, there is no such way.

mouseBind.title: Is it possible to bind some function to the mouse wheel or rebind the camera movement?
mouseBind.content: No, there is no such possibility.

smartAttack.title: Is it possible to enable "smart attack"?
smartAttack.content: No, there is no such function.

lobby15.title: Is it possible to create a separate 5x5 lobby with the ability to choose the mode and other parameters?

content.part1: Yes, this feature is available when purchasing a subscription
content.part3: or by agreement with the administration.

meta.title: How can I learn the meta of an old patch?

content.part3: on our website and go to

content.part1: On the page of the past match, click on the "Download replay" button. You will be redirected to a page with a detailed guide on how to watch this replay, for example,

info_page.projectDescription: General state of affairs on the project, who is involved, a bit of history.
info_page.siteEssence: What is the essence of the site?
info_page.onlineOldDotaExplanation: This site helps to play online in the old version of Dota 2. We offer login via Steam, convenient game search, client link, support and useful materials about the version.
info_page.freeOldDotaOpportunity: We give everyone the opportunity to play old Dota online for free. If you violate the rules, we can disable access to the service.
info_page.differencesExplanation: The game looks completely different now than it did 10 years ago. Some people liked the changes, some didn't, and we're not saying the old version is the best. But everyone might be interested in trying the original. Here's how they differ:
info_page.oldMapDetails: Old map - less neutral creep camps, roshan on the river, side shops.
info_page.heroStatsDetails: Heroes have much less health and mana and more damage - having 700 hp at 15 minutes is normal. Any ability in the lane spends a lot of mana, but also deals a lot of damage. Spending an ability to finish off a creep is a much more important decision.
info_page.originalHeroesDetails: Original heroes and their abilities - many abilities that in the current version either do not exist or have been greatly transformed. For example, Pudge, who is here affected by skill 2.
info_page.roleSeparationDetails: Hard role separation: support needs to gank to earn money. There are much fewer creeps on the map, and kills give a bigger reward.
info_page.costToMaintainSite: How much does it cost to maintain this site?
info_page.fixedExpenseDetails: Required: renting servers for the site host and other infrastructure services (storage, analytics, databases). This part is almost fixed and costs about {{amount}} per month. In case of large influxes, this part also has to be scaled, expenses increase to {{amount}} per month.
info_page.scalableExpenseDetails: Scalable: depending on the online, we need a different number of game servers to ensure that everyone has enough slots to play. This expense is easy to predict: one optimal game server gives 3-4 parallel games, and costs {{amount}} per month. If the online is high, like during Pari Rivals 6.84, around 180 parallel players - we get about 30 parallel games, so the server expense will be {{amount}} per month.
info_page.advertExpenseDetails: Advertising: the most flexible part of expenses. Here we are very dependent on the supply on the market (which YouTubers are willing to cooperate for how much, for example), and, of course, our financial capabilities. We are always happy to collaborate, and we do not refuse cheap advertising :)
info_page.approximateExpenses: So, you can get approximate costs for maintenance: with a low online of 5-10 parallel games, this is {{lowOnline}} per month. If the online increases, advertising or news triggers, expenses can grow to {{highOnline}}.
info_page.projectTeam: Who is working on the project?
info_page.projectHistoryExplanation: Classic Dota has passed through many hands: Western enthusiasts were the first to start hosting games in 2019. After that, there were 2 communities for quite a long time: Western and CIS in the form of Discord servers. Then, from 2021 to the end of 2024, all games were on the site https://dota2classic.com From September 2024 to the present, all games are hosted on this site, the development and support of which is carried out by:
info_page.communityManagerDetails: {{name}} - "community manager", public relations, advertising, studying large texts and generating smart phrases
info_page.wikiDeveloperDetails: {{name}} - item and hero wiki developer, main scapegoat of matchmaking experiments
info_page.contributorsList: List of people who contributed to the development of classic Dota:
info_page.ancient678Details: Ancient678 - created a CIS server for classic Dota
info_page.samovarDetails: Samovar Man - it was thanks to him that many players first saw classic Dota
info_page.sittingBullDetails: SittingBull - wrote the first automatic server host via discord bot, wrote the first server plugins
info_page.deathTBODetails: DeathTBO - has been running dota2classic.com for years
info_page.alisonDetails: Alison - wrote many useful server plugins
info_page.konakonaqqDetails: konakonaqq - help in writing server plugins
info_page.otherContributors: Many others - who are hard to remember, but they were definitely there and helped
info_page.finalGoal: What is the final goal of the project?
info_page.stableOnlineGoal: Stable online, which allows you to find a balanced game with players of a similar level in ± 10 minutes at almost any time of the day. A cozy place where it will be interesting to play for everyone: both newcomers to the old Dota and inveterate old-timers. The project's content is fully paid for by the players and there is a way out in the plus for a stable flow of advertising.

player_settings.recalibrationDescription: Recalibration is a chance to reset your rating to the starting one and recalibrate. Suitable for those who are sure that they deserve more or want to start with a clean slate. You can only use recalibration once per season.
player_settings.avoidedPlayersInfo: Dotaclassic Plus subscribers can add up to one player to their avoided players list. This will ensure that you never end up on the same team with an unpleasant player.
player_settings.connectTwitchProfile: Connect your Twitch profile to your account and get additional features!
player_settings.twitchBenefits: Once linked, a link to your stream will appear in your profile and a special icon in the chat that will distinguish you from other users. If you are broadcasting our game, we will automatically show a link to your running stream so that viewers can easily find your channel. This is a great way to attract a new audience and make your stream more noticeable! 🎮📺

store_landing.title: dotaclassic plus
store_landing.subscriptionText: You help develop the old Dota: online grows, matches improve, new functionality appears. And you also get nice privileges and exclusive features - as a token of gratitude for your support.
store_landing.profileDecorationText: Choose from a variety of styles, frames and effects to highlight your personality and stand out from the crowd. Let your profile speak for you even without words.
store_landing.dodgeListText: Think you're back together? Not today. Add a player to your dodge list and you'll never be on the same team again. Tired of the same "heroes of the match"? Get your perfect lineup on at least one side of the screen.
store_landing.unbanHeroText: Hero banned? This is not a reason to give up your favorite character. Dotaclassic plus subscribers can choose banned heroes.
store_landing.inGamePraiseText: You can support your teammate for a hard-working game - or subtly tease your opponent for a fail. Everything is like in the current version. We added it so that the classic version would have a little more emotion.
store_landing.muteText: Don't want to read messages, receive invites or see other people's comments on your profile anymore? Block a player and they will disappear from your gaming space. Peace of mind guaranteed.
store_landing.lobbyText: Gather your friends, choose a map, turn on (or off) bots and decide for yourself how the match will go. Private game - your rules, your rhythm, your team.
store_landing.recalibrationText: Once per season, you can reset your rating to the starting one and play 10 calibration games again. Maybe this time the system will understand who is a real fighter for MMR?

tables.radiantVictory: Victory of the Forces of the World
tables.direVictory: Victory of the Forces of Darkness

vacancies_page.projectNeeds: What talents does the dotaclassic project need
vacancies_page.projectIntro: The {{project}} project is based on the enthusiasm of people for whom the old Dota is more than just "custom". We accept any help, but, unfortunately, for free - the project is non-profit and all profits go to development.
vacancies_page.volunteerNote: All "vacancies" imply no monetary compensation, but at the same time, the candidate is not expected to make an exorbitant impact.
vacancies_page.productManagerDescription: Our project really needs a person who will direct the development of the product. We have development resources, some analytics, but we spend too little time working with users and are developing in a "rough" direction.
vacancies_page.contentManagerDescription: We have a telegram channel, a discord server, tiktok and youtube - but there is very little content in them and it is not put into production. Developing a content plan, regularly posting to channels - we simply do not have enough hands for all this.
vacancies_page.productAnalystDescription: We have a platform for metrics and building analytics, but lack professionalism. Compiling analytical queries, building product dashboards in grafana, and most importantly - understanding user behavior and putting forward hypotheses.
vacancies_page.frontendDevDescription: The main site is written in NextJS, but some components (like item previews) are written in Vue. There are many interesting features to be developed, as well as refactoring of the existing code base.
vacancies_page.uiDesignerDescription: The site has a "germ" of style, but lacks a general design system and structure. An experienced designer will help us achieve uniformity, visual stability and ease of use.
vacancies_page.backendDevDescription: The backend mainly consists of NestJS services communicating via Rest, RabbitMQ and Redis. The main tasks are to implement new features in existing services, implement new services, write and support integration and unit tests.
vacancies_page.srcdsDevDescription: Very specific work - development and support of existing sourcemod plugins, config settings and work with other source tools - hammer and others
vacancies_page.discordModeratorDescription: We would be happy to help you set up a discord server so that it is easy to use, important information is easily accessible to newcomers, and it is easy for moderators to maintain order.
vacancies_page.contactInstruction: write to me in telegram. Please, specify what exactly you are interested in, and also tell me about your experience - I will be very interested!
